wikipedia_page.main:
Herbert Barrett Curteis (1793–1847) was an English Whig politician.
He sat in the House of Commons of the United Kingdom for 13 years between 1830 and 1837.  He was  Member of Parliament (MP) for Sussex from 1830 to 1832, for East Sussex, and for Rye, Sussex, from 1841 until his death in 1847.Curteis was educated at Westminster School and Christ Church, Oxford, where he matriculated in 1812, and graduated B.A. in 1815.

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1830 United Kingdom general election
List of MPs elected in the 1831 United Kingdom general election

response: Curteis was born in Florence, Italy, the only son of Herbert Barrett Curteis who was touring Italy with his wife at the time. He was educated at Westminster School and Christ Church, Oxford. His father was Member of Parliament for Rye, Sussex, from 1841 until 1847 when he died leaving 'large landed estates' to Herbert Mascall Curteis, who succeeded him in the representation of Rye and served until the next general election in 1852. He died at his house, Windmill Hill Place, near Hailsham, Sussex.

The 1847 Rye by-election was held on 23 December 1847 at the town hall, Rye.From the LONDON GAZETTE, Friday, Dec. 24 > The Times (London, England), Saturday, Dec 25, 1847; pg. 4; Issue 19742 It was called after the death of the incumbent Herbert Barrett CurteisHistory of Parliament on-line (Whig).'Births, Deaths, Marriages and Obituaries' The Standard (London, England), Wednesday, December 15, 1847; Issue 7286  His son Herbert Mascall Curteis,National Archives  also a Whig, was elected unopposed.Multiple News Items. The Morning Post (London, England), Saturday, December 25, 1847; Issue 23104.
